value: human rights advocate writer and
dissident Leo jabo died the other day in
China he did not die in jail but that's
where he spent the years leading up to
his death from multiple organ failure a
prisoner on the grounds that his work
with seditious and dangerous to the aims
of the Chinese government Leo had
received the Nobel Prize for his work he
was a hero of the West the omage is -
his life that filled the pages of
Western newspapers the literati in
Europe and North America clamor to pay
him their respects
Leo jabo believed in freedom of speech
and the press he admired liberal Western
democracies and he sang the praises of
American policy and way of life he spoke
out even on the israel-palestine
conflict and bravely chose aside
Israel's calling Palestinians the
agitators for these thought crimes and
for the attention he brought to his
alternative way of seeing the world the
Chinese government considered him an
enemy they charged him and imprisoned
him even after his death the Chinese
government sent out warnings to foreign
leaders telling them they would not
approve of any kind words directed at
this most hated and dangerous proponent
of Western enlightenment Leo shall Bo
the men may be gone but Leo shall Bo's
ideas remain and the Chinese government
fears them still we do things
differently in the West we tell
ourselves we embrace and embody
everything Leo shall bow fought for we
awarded Leo the Nobel Prize we enshrined
his memory in words like courage honor
integrity and hero surely all of this
stands as proof that we in the West are
opposed to the silencing of outspoken
advocates for free speech and democracy
that's what we tell ourselves the fact
is that one Western liberal democracy
Canada does jail its dissidents it
doesn't admit that that's what it's
doing of course and it truly hates to
involve the official legal apparatus at
all if it can help it
Canada chooses to prop up its veneer of
freedoms by using obfuscating
terminology such as hate speech and by
employing quasi-judicial human rights
boards along with control of the press
and vigorous social shaming and
intimidation
consider for a moment that Leos elbow is
not a cartoon figure he's a real man
with a full story that full story
includes his serious legal battle and
therefore it includes a relationship
with a lawyer
Leo's lawyers name was mol Xiao ping
what would the West say about moe Xiao
ping what would China do with such a man
well we have to speculate about the
former to some degree I can tell you
what China thinks of this top human
rights lawyer who defends Chinese
citizens accused of crimes against the
state or whose rights such as they are
are threatened by the Chinese system mr.
Xiao ping in China has suffered
harassment has had his phones tapped has
been threatened and has been monitored
by the people he was fighting against
the government why does he continue to
do his work in spite of losing many
battles and taking on these personal
risks while mr. Xiao ping says that the
law cannot function if lawyers do not
fight for these values he says that his
work and the work of his fellow human
rights lawyers is worth the risks they
take and that history will judge if what
is happening now is right or wrong
Western people will hear all of this and
doubtless conclude that the Chinese
government is acting in an undemocratic
and despotic fashion in its bid to
silence and intimidate not only
outspoken opponents but more shockingly
even the lawyers who are hired to
represent them the Western ego is a
strange thing because the minute we
congratulate ourselves for spotting
injustice in China we can turn the page
of the newspaper and become enraged that
a memorial service for a controversial
Canadian human rights lawyer was allowed
to go ahead in the Toronto Public
Library Barbara cool Eska defended
Canadian citizens whose descriptions
often match those of Leo jabo people who
ran afoul of the government's approved
narratives ended up being branded not as
dissidents but as hate criminals one
wonders if all China needs to do is
change a few words here and there in
their laws in order to bring itself
fully in line with what passes for
Western democratic freedoms in this day
and age but I hear my fellow Westerners
cry but Kalasha is no Xiao ping she
defended people who wanted to deny the
Holocaust and who believed in race
and who wanted citizenship in Canada in
spite of having been convicted of war
crimes
well I'll remind you Westerners that
your image of these defendants is
crafted by the media if you were to stop
and think for a moment you might realize
that you know absolutely nothing about
the reality of those people you are
quick to demonize the vast majority of
people reacting with anger to the
memorial at the library are doing so
based on only one or two news stories
maybe just one does anyone know anything
about Paul from for example other than
his name and the label the media has
pasted on to him does no one see that
the war criminal coup lashka fought for
to win his right to emigrate back to
Canada would if he applied today win the
case and be welcomed under Trudeau's new
law how differently all of this could be
presented to you I'm pointing out to you
that there are two sides to every story
and more than that there are multiple
lenses through which it could be viewed
do you any of you think that people in
China fought for Leo shall Bose released
from prison or that they gather to mourn
him now that he's dead do you imagine
that everyone in China secretly
understands or openly understands that
Zhao Beau and his lawyers were and are
champions of their rights and freedoms
they don't they don't gather they don't
mourn they don't think his lawyer for
his work why not because they barely
know of the man's existence and what
they do know they get spoon-fed to them
through the news media let me read to
you a synopsis of the Chinese press
coverage of mr. Zhao Bo's passing this
is from The Associated Press headline
Chinese media says Nobel laureate Liu
Xiaobo led astray by West as tributes
rolled in Friday to mourn China's most
famous political prisoner a newspaper
published by the ruling Communist Party
dismissed late Nobel Peace Prize
laureate Leo jabo as a pawn of the West
whose legacy will soon fade the
newspapers editorial marked a rare
mention of Leo in the Chinese language
media Leo died Thursday of liver cancer
while serving an 11-year sentence for
incitement to subvert state power he was
61 years old
Leo lived
tragic life because he sought to
confront Chinese mainstream society with
outside support the Global Times said
Leo's last days were politicized by the
forces overseas they said they used
Leo's illness as a tool to burst boost
their image and demonize China the West
has bestowed upon Leo a halo which will
not linger it said by granting him the
Nobel Prize the West has kidnapped Leo
however the West only puts a halo on
those useful to them why Leo did have
considerable renown abroad official
censorship made him virtually a
non-person at home the party frequently
uses the specter of Western manipulation
to demonize its critics that's from The
Associated Press you know what it makes
me think well in the West we can't use
the specter of Western manipulation to
demonize our critics no instead we use
the specter of racism sexism
Islamophobia transphobia white privilege
heteronormativity colonial power
patriarchy and a host of other labels to
demonize ours come to look at it this
way and reading off that long and yet
incomplete list of ideological weaponry
wielded against people by the state in
Canada there might be a case to be made
that people are in fact allowed more
freedom of expression in China than here
in Leo shell bows idolized West is out
